chargeHist.descr: Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)
Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)

result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (5th or 6th) and Operating w/ PAC (5th or 6th). The defendant was found guilty of OWI (5th or 6th) and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (5th or 6th) was dismissed by the court.

  • Van B. Howard was found guilty of OWI (5th or 6th), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Concurrent to Lake County IL case 12CF2879.
***Corrected JOC - Total F&C is $2927.00***

superMiscConds.notes: If probation or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.  This applies to all counts and financial obligations.

Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.  Pay supervision fees.  Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by your agent, which may include: alcohol/drug, anger management/DV counseling, psychiatric/psychological, AODA Assessment and follow-through with recommended treatment.
*   Pay total fine of $2927.00 (which included IID, DNA extraditiion costs)
*   Defendant is ordered to submit to a DNA sample & pay DNA surcharge and notice is given.
May not possess any weapons, including firearms.

records.addlTxt: Attorney Jessica Krejcarek appeared for the State. Atty R Ogren appeared on behalf of deft, who did not appear. Clerk/H. Barnett. Deft is in the hospital from prison. Atty Ogren's motion for deft to be released and have remainder of incarceration time applied to extended supervision. Court does not modify sentence at this time for reasons set forth on the record; motion held in abeyance.

Letter to the Court
Submitted by Atty Ryan Ogren

Attorney Carli McNeill appeared for the State. Atty R Ogren appeared on behalf of deft. Clerk/H. Barnett. Deft's appearance is excused. Atty Ogren's motion to modify sentence due to deft's medical condition. Court contacts John/Dodge Correctional off the record who advises that the petition filed at John Burke Correctional did not cover all of the requirements, they need an affidavit signed by a Dr, who previously refused to sign one. Court holds motion in abeyance; may be scheduled by Atty Ogren once proper documentation is received.
Motion hearing on September 19, 2017 at 01:30 pm.

records.addlTxt: Attorney Carli McNeill appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney P Marry.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  Court imposes a total sentence of 5 years WSP concurrent to Lake County IL case 12CF2879:  2 years initial confinement w/credit for 46 days served, 3 years extended supervision w/conditions; deft is not eligible for CIP; deft is eligible for SAP; $2,927.00 total fine/costs (including IID surcharge, $250 DNA surcharge, $400 extradition costs), to be paid during period of extended supervision; 3 year revocation of DL; IID; OWI assessment.
Extradition Costs Determined slip received.

Attorney Carli McNeill appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney P Marry.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  On State's motion, cts 2 & 3 are dismissed.  Deft pleads guilty.  Court finds deft guilty.  PSI ordered.  DNA sample ordered.  SEH 3/17/16 at 10am.  Bond continued.

1:45 pm   Attorney Jennifer Phan appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney Phil Marry,  Clerk:  JT.  Referred to Br. 6 for a Plea Hrg on 2-5-16 @ 11:00.  Warrant vacated  $2000 cash bond set with conditions.  /dls
Returned on Warrant/Initial Appearance  canceled with Renee / Gina at 239 p.m.

*Not to Possess or Consume Alcohol.  *Not To Possess or Consume Controlled Substances w/o a Prescription.  *Not to drive w/o VALID Driver's License.
346.63(1)(a) - OWI /5th  346.63(1)(b) - PAC / 5 th  343.44(1)(b) - OAR
Bond returned to poster per Court Order.  jk/cp  ck# 15CH075341

Attorney Jennifer Phan appeared for the State.  Atty P Marry appeared on behalf of deft, who did not appear.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  SY appeared, requesting return of bond.  Atty Marry states the deft is still in custody in Lake County, will be entering a plea on his return, does not oppose request for return of bond.  Court orders bond to be returned to poster.  Warrant remains in effect.
Bail/bond hearing at 11-23-2015 09:00 am
from SY to Judge.

Attorney Carli McNeill appeared for the State.  Atty P Marry appeared on behalf of deft, who did not appear.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  Deft is in custody in IL facing revocation.  Court does NOT forfeit bond, issues warrant $10,000 cash bond.
WCS report.

NO RECORD MADE.  Attorney Michael Graveley appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney P Marry.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  Atty Marry requests to reschedule to after deft's next hearing in Lake County on 9/11.  PLEAS set for 9/28/15 at 8:45am.  Bond continued.
WCS Supervision Status Report.  Defendant has satisfied the program requirements per Statute 85.53.
With Atty Marry the time of the FPT on 8/21/15 is changed from 8:45am to 11:30am as the deft has court in IL.

Attorney Carli McNeill appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney P Marry.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  Atty Marry states the deft completed the Chapter 85 program but has some fines to pay from IL Veteran's court.  FPT continued to 8/21/15 at 8:45am.  Bond continued.
WCS report;  Defendant has successfully completed Chapter 85.53 requirements.

Attorney Carli McNeill appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney P Marry.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  Atty Marry states the deft is close to completing veterans court in IL.  FPT set for 7/9/15 at 8:45am.  Bond continued.
WCS report;  Defendant has successfully completed Chapter 85.53 requirements.
With Tammy/Atty Marry the PLEAS of 3/27/15 at 8:45am is rescheduled, as Atty Marry had a death in the family; reset to 5/7/15 at 8:30am.

Attorney Rosa Delgado appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney P Marry.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  Court amends criminal complaint as set forth on the record.  Court cancels warrant and reinstates bond.  PLEAH set for 3/27/15 at 8:45am.  Bond continued.
WCS report.
With Atty Marry a VA is set for 2/9/15 at 2:30pm; the deft will be released from the Lake Co Jail on 2/6/15.

Attorney Rosa Delgado appeared for the State.  Atty P Marry appeared on behalf of deft, who did not appear.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  Atty Marry states the deft is in custody at the Lake County Jail; believes he will be out by end of the month.  Court forfeits bond and issues warrant $5,000 cash bond, stayed until 2/2/15 at 5pm.
WCS report; the deft has not yet satisfied the program requirements.
WCS report.
With Atty Marry and ADA Delgado the PLEAS of 12/17/14 at 9am is rescheduled, as the deft is not ready to enter a plea on that date; reset to 1-27-15 at 8:30am.

Attorney Rosa Delgado appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney P Marry.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  Atty Marry states the deft is in treatment at the VA, states that there is a case pending in IL and that this charge should be the 4th offense.  JS of 12/8/14 at 9am is removed from the calendar; PLEAS set for 12/17/14 at 9am.  Bond continued.
WCS report; the deft has not yet satisfied the program requirements.
WCS reporting is suspended from 8/12/14-8/19/14.

Attorney Carli McNeill appeared for the State.  Def. appeared with Atty Philip Marry.  Clerk K. Zirbel.  Atty Marry is attempting to get def. into Veteran's Court.  Status conf. 11/5/14 at 8:30.  Jury selection 12/8/14 at 9:00.  Jury trial 12/9/14 at 9:00.  Bond continued.
from WCS.  Def. is enrolled in AODA treatment; expected completion date is 10/30/14.

Attorney Carli McNeill appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney P Marry.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  Atty Marry states the deft had his assessment and will be starting treatment.  STC continued to 8/6/14 at 8:30am.  Bond continued.
WCS report; the deft has not yet satisfied the program requirements.

Attorney Carli McNeill appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney P Marry.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  Atty Marry states they have applied to the VA court; also states the deft is in counselling 3 times a week.  STC set for 6/2/14 at 9am.  Bond continued.
WCS report; the deft has not yet satisfied the program requirements.
Final pre-trial on April 25, 2014 at 09:00 am.
with Atty Marry the FPT of 4/22/14 at 8:45am is rescheduled, due to a conflict w/the court's calendar; reset to 4/25/14 at 9am.
No disposition. Leave on for next scheduled court activity.

Attorney Carli McNeill appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney P Marry.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  Atty Marry acknowledges receipt and waives reading.  Deft enters not guilty pleas.  DA PTC 3/21/14 at 1:30pm and FPT 4/22/14 at 8:45am.  Atty Marry states the deft is going to FL be with sick mother.  Court suggests going on SCRAM bracelet for that time.  Bond continued.
WCS report; the deft has not yet satisfied the program requirements.

Attorney Carli McNeill appeared for the State. Def. appeared in court with Atty. Philip Marry. Clerk LE.  Plea offer placed on the record by ADA McNeill.  Prelim. waived, probable cause found. Bound over to Br. 6 for arraignment on 3-13-14 @ 8:15am. Information not filed. State to file within statutory time limits. Bond continued.

Compliant. All breathalyzers conducted have tested negative for alcohol use. Def. must complete primary treatment and pay the remaining balance on his client service fee.

Compliant. All breathalyzers conducted have tested negative for alcohol use. Ther def. must complete primary treatment and pay the remainint balance on his client service fee.

Defendant is not eligible for public defender representation.
$3500 deposited on 1/21/14

250 p.m.  Attorney Tracey Braun appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney C Bennett.  Clk  LE.  Deft will retain his own counsel.  Initial appearance adjourned to 2/4/14 @ 1:00pm w/Comm Mason, 927-54th Street, Rm 157, Kenosha, WI.  Atty Status.  $3500  Cash Bond Set w/conditions (see bond entry).  4th par P.C.
